Articles.Content:
Now, I was watching the Bugs Bunny movie, and Duck Dodgers in the 24th 1/2 century came up and Daffy mentioned kerbal miles.... ... .. Is this the origin? The origin of Kerbal the name? 

33600 kerbal miles due up!

Az

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-06T01:42:16Z" title="03/06/2015 01:42  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 6, 2015</time> by Azuratte**

Link here [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RqAUiUDyFlY](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RqAUiUDyFlY)

Go to 2:33 in.

However, this cartoon makes me sad as it reminds me how everything modern is SO crud compared to this genius of a cartoon. Oh well ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

***WHAT***

You, sir, have blown my mind. Have an internet cookie!

> 
> Now, I was watching the Bugs Bunny movie, and Duck Dodgers in the 21st 1/2 century came up and Daffy mentioned kerbal miles.... ... .. Is this the origin? The origin of Kerbal the name? 
> 33600 kerbal miles due up!
> 
> Az

241/2th century, and WHAT?

Interesting.......

Maybe a coincidence? Or maybe Harvester had some help coming up with his rocket names...

From what I have read, that may not be the origin, just a neat coincidence. Check out [this old thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/8995-I-have-found-it%21%21-THE-ORIGINAL-KERBO-LOG%21) of KSP history.
I'm not sure how "*turbo*miles" leads to "Kerbal".

Perhaps Harv saw this cartoon when he was younger and the word just hung out in the back of his mind until they were playing around with rockets. His mind drew the connection for him and he didn't even know it...

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I'm not sure how "*turbo*miles" leads to "Kerbal".

It may have been "Turbo miles"

> 
> Link here [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RqAUiUDyFlY](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RqAUiUDyFlY)
> Go to 2:33 in.
> 
> However, this cartoon makes me sad as it reminds me how everything modern is SO crud compared to this genius of a cartoon. Oh well ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

"Oops! had the silly thing in reverse" That's just the best! So Kerbal It had me laughing so hard, I forgot about the "Kerbal" reference, had to go back and watch it again.

> 
> I'm not sure how "*turbo*miles" leads to "Kerbal".

Daffy clearly says kerbal, or it could be kerbol - listen to the sharpe 'ker' sound.
yes I thought I was wrong when he said turbomiles. But I hear "ker".

Definitely the "ker" in Kerbal being said here.

I'm still freaking out! ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

He said "turbo miles", Its just his slur that makes it sound like "kerbo miles". [Here is a quote from IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0045709/quotes?item=qt0510864)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-06T02:22:13Z" title="03/06/2015 02:22  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 6, 2015</time> by Hunter3081**

> 
> He said "Turbo Miles", Its just his slur that makes it sound like "Kerbo Miles". [Here is a quote from IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0045709/quotes?item=qt0510864)

It's close enough to allow for the possibility...

I'm quite fine with agreeing that if you took the original script and read it, that it would read "turbomiles". But as for someone remembering childhood watching the episode on an old school TV set you'd have to agree you'd hear it "Kerbalmiles".
